prompt.content:
How has HEICOâ€™s acquisition-driven growth share (i.e., portion of net sales growth due to acquisitions vs organic) evolved over FY2022 -> FY2024? Is acquisition growth increasing or decreasing as a proportion of overall growth? 
 
 Note the % of net sales that can be attributed to acquisition each year, as well as the YoY growth %'s. Compare this to overall growth trends for sales, and note whether or not acquisition growth is increasing as a proportion of overall growth.

rubrics.name: Consolidated net sales FY21 1865.7mm --> FY22: 2208.3mm. +342.6mm increase, = +18.36% YoY

messages.content: Consolidated net sales FY21 1865.7mm --> FY22: 2208.3mm. +342.6mm increase, = +18.36% YoY

rubrics.name: Acquisition impact on consolidated net sales growth rose from 38.23% in FY22 to 63.68% in FY23 to 76.88% in FY24, which indicates that acquisitions are accounting for an increasing proportion of overall sales growth in the FY22 to FY24 period.

messages.content: Acquisition impact on consolidated net sales growth rose from 38.23% in FY22 to 63.68% in FY23 to 76.88% in FY24, which indicates that acquisitions are accounting for an increasing proportion of overall sales growth in the FY22 to FY24 period.
